intro: Eupatorium orbiculatum, commonly known as roundleaf thoroughwort, is a perennial herb native to the eastern United States. It features upright stems that are often hairy and can grow up to 2 meters in height. The plant produces small, white to pale pink flowers arranged in dense clusters at the top of the stems. Its leaves are broadly ovate, with toothed margins and a rough texture. It thrives in moist, sunny environments and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks.
